intro: Phoradendron durangense, commonly known as the Durango mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its lack of roots and reliance on host trees for water and nutrients. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers and red berries that are dispersed by birds. It typically grows on the branches of oak and pine trees, forming dense clusters. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological interactions in its native habitat.
